Hi,

I am trying to use HyperNEAT for action selection in the half field of=
fense task (RoboCup soccer) for both the attacker and defender team and hav=
e some problems regarding the state representation.

So far I have used the=
 same state representation as in Stanley's and Verbancsics' paper "Evolving=
 static representations for task transfer" (BEV).
I have 3 different ANNs f=
or action selection of the attacker with ball (dribble, pass, shoot), attac=
ker without ball (move to open position) and defender (mark player, interce=
pt ball).

Attacker with ball:
The input layer is marked with the positions=
 of attacker with ball (+1), attackers without ball (+0.5), position of the=
 goal posts (+0.5), positions of defenders (-1), paths from attacker with b=
all to its teammates (+0.3), to defenders (-0.3) and to the goal posts (+0.=
3). The highest output value determines the action: dribble towards goal (a=
t attacker with ball position), pass (at teammate position) or shoot (at go=
al post position).
The achieved performance is a little bit better than a s=
imple handcoded solution, but I wonder a few things:
The solution is not re=
ally aware of the distances of the attacker with ball to its teammates and =
to the goal, which results in attempted shots from the middle line and pass=
es to teammates far away. I tried using path values corresponding to the di=
stances and no paths at all, but the performance is similar. I also tried t=
o use a lengthCppn-input (as in the visual discrimination task), but that d=
oes not show any performance gain.
Is there a better way to represent the s=
tate and shoot action?


Attacker without ball:
The input layer is marked w=
ith the position of attacker with ball (+1), attackers without ball (+0.5) =
except the attacker requesting an action and defenders (-1). The highest ou=
tput value determines the position to which the agent should move.
This doe=
s not work at all. All attackers tend to move to the same positions.

Defen=
ders:
The input layer is marked with the position of attackers (-1), positi=
ons of teammates (+0.5) and the defender requesting an action (+1). The hig=
hest output value determines wether to intercept the ball (at attacker with=
 ball position) or to mark an attacker (at attacker without ball position).=

This representation suffers the same problem as attackers without ball: al=
l defenders execute the same action (mark same player, intercept ball).

I =
probably miss something because this is my first experiment with HyperNEAT.=
 I'd appreciate any tips for the representation of the state in the input l=
ayer, especially for attackers without ball and defenders.

Kind regards,
T=
